## Gene Details:
- **Gene ID:** [AT4G24390](https://www.arabidopsis.org/locus?name=AT4G24390)
- **Gene Symbol:** <u>AFB4</u>
- **Gene Name:** auxin signaling F-box 4
- **Description:**   RNI-like superfamily protein;(source:Araport11)
- **TAIR Accession:** 
- **Genome:** [Araport11_genome_release](https://www.arabidopsis.org/download/list?dir=Genes%2FAraport11_genome_release)
- **Species:** *Arabidopsis thaliana*

## Germplasm Phenotype:
   - [CS72715]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Plants that are hemizygous for the complementing transgene are shorter and slightly less fertile than WT. Plants homozygous for it are closer to WT in stature and fertility. Hemizygous plants siliques contain roughly 75% viable embryos expressing mCitrine (and mCherry & mOrange2) and the other 25% lack fluorescence and display embryo defects at the 16-cell stage or earlier.	
AT4G24390	CS72716	Plants that are hemizygous for the complementing transgene are shorter and slightly less fertile than WT. Plants homozygous for it are closer to WT in stature and fertility. Hemizygous plants siliques contain roughly 75% viable embryos expressing mCitrine (and mCherry & mOrange2) and the other 25% lack fluorescence and display embryo defects at the 16-cell stage or earlier.
   - [CS72717]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Rosettes are significantly smaller and inflorescences are substantially shorter and substantially more branched than those of WT. Some siliques have incomplete valves.
   - [CS72719]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Rosettes are significantly smaller and inflorescences are substantially shorter and more branched than those of WT. Some siliques have incomplete valves.
   - [CS72720]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Rosettes are significantly smaller and inflorescences are substantially shorter and more branched than those of WT. Some siliques have incomplete valves.
   - [CS72727]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;less YFP signal than line 3 (CS72728)
   - [CS72728]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;More YFP signal than line 1 (CS72727). Increased sensitivity to picloram.
   - [SALK_201329C]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Reduced sensitivity to picloran
